'''Spritzee''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''シュシュプ''' ''Shushupu'') is a {{type|Fairy}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Aromatisse}} when [[trade]]d holding a [[Sachet]].

==Biology==
Spritzee is a pink avian Pokémon with a white beak that takes up most of its face, reminiscent of a doctor's mask. It has orange eyes with long lashes that lay near the beak. It has a large, curly tuft of feathers on top of its head, as well as two small, pink wings. Its feet are light purple, and appear to curl up into its body during flight. The scent it emits, which can vary depending on its diet, enraptures those who smell it.

==In the anime==
[[File:Valerie Spritzee.png|thumb|left|Spritzee in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
A Spritzee appeared in ''[[XY073|A Fashionable Battle!]]'' and ''[[XY074|Fairy-Type Trickery!]]'', under the ownership of [[Valerie]]. Spritzee was first used in Valerie's Gym battle against [[Sawyer]], where it battled against {{p|Bagon}} and won. It was used in her Gym battle against {{Ash}}, where it managed to beat {{AP|Fletchinder}} but lost to {{AP|Hawlucha}}. Valerie's Spritzee reappeared in ''[[XY135|Rocking Kalos Defenses!]]'' and ''[[XY136|Forming a More Perfect Union!]]'', where it participated in the fight against the [[Giant Rock]].

===Minor appearances===
Two Spritzee debuted in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', where Ash saw them while stepping out of the airplane upon his arrival at [[Kalos]]. They appeared again in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]'', during a flashback.

Spritzee made cameo appearances in ''[[XY005|A Blustery Santalune Gym Battle!]]'', ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]'', ''[[XY021|A PokéVision of Things to Come!]]'', and ''[[XY028|The Bonds of Evolution!]]''.

Multiple Spritzee appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A Spritzee appeared in a flashback in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

A Trainer's Spritzee appeared during a flashback in ''[[SS036|The Legend of X, Y, and Z!]]''.

Two Spritzee appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Team Flare Spritzee Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Spritzee in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Spritzee debuted in ''[[PAXY01|An X-cuse to Come Out and Play]]'' with its trainer in [[Vaniville Town]].

In ''[[PAXY03|Inn-teresting Developements]]'', a Spritzee is seen in Aquacorde Town that belonged to an old woman who is a {{tc|Team Flare Grunt}}.

A Spritzee appeared in a flashback in ''[[PAXY27|Pinsir Glares]]''.

A few Spritzee were later seen by the Sundial at [[Anistar City]] in ''[[PAXY29|Hawlucha Attack]]'', which they were soon startled by Zygarde and flew away.

==Trivia==
* Spritzee was designed by [[Saya Tsuruta]].

===Origin===
Spritzee seems to be based both on a bird, sharing some traits with {{wp|Hummingbird|hummingbirds}} and a possible coloration reference to {{wp|flamingo}}s, as well as a {{wp|perfume}} bottle's squeeze bulb. The shape of its beak is also reminiscent of parrots, more specifically {{wp|Major Mitchell's cockatoo}}, which is pink and has a frilly feather crest while mature female has red eyes. Given the round white area on its face it may also draw inspiration from traditional {{wp|carnival}} masks used in central and southern parts of Europe, and masks worn at {{wp|masquerade ball}}s. Its fluffy body may be based on powder puffs or other cosmetics applicators. Its perfumes and avian qualities and origins may mean that Spritzee and Aromatisse could have possibly been based on {{wp|plague doctor}}s, who used various perfumes held in bird-like masks to drown out the scent of the plague and deceased.

====Name origin====
Spritzee is from ''spritz'' (a spray of liquid) and ''Fee'' (German for fairy).

Shushupu may be from プシュー ''pushū'' (onomatopoeia for spraying).
